extendedIngredients.name: basmati rice
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup (1/2 pound) raw long grain white rice such as basmati, rinsed

extendedIngredients.name: dried apricots
extendedIngredients.originalString: ¾ cup dried apricots, thinly sliced

extendedIngredients.name: ground pepper
extendedIngredients.originalString: ¼ teaspoon fresh ground black pepper

extendedIngredients.aisle: Nut butters, Jams, and Honey;Health Foods
extendedIngredients.name: honey
olive oil
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ cup good quality olive oil

extendedIngredients.name: orange juice
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup orange juice (to soak the cranberries)

extendedIngredients.name: orange zest
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 orange, zested and juiced (1/4 cup fresh squeezed orange juice, 1 teaspoon orange zest)

extendedIngredients.name: pecan
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1½ cups pecan halves, toasted (Toss frequently in a dry pan over medium heat for 3 minutes until they darken and become fragrant. Watch carefully so they don't burn)
metaInformation: for 3 minutes until they darken and become fragrant. watch carefully so they don't burn)

extendedIngredients.name: rice
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup (1/2 pound) raw wild rice, rinsed

extendedIngredients.name: white balsamic vinegar
extendedIngredients.originalString: 3 tablespoons white balsamic vinegar (or substitute sherry vinegar)

extendedIngredients.name: yellow onions
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 yellow onions, peeled, halved and thinly sliced (1/8-inch)

recipes.title: Wild Rice Salad with Cranberries, Apricots and Pecans

winePairing.pairingText: Salad works really well with Chardonnay, Gruener Veltliner, and Sauvignon Blanc. Sauvignon Blanc and Gruner Veltliner both have herby notes that complement salads with enough acid to match tart vinaigrettes, while a Chardonnay can be a good pick for creamy salad dressings. The NV Mindbender Chardonnay with a 4.4 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 12 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: NV Mindbender Chardonnay
productMatches.description: Lightly Oaked, the Mindbender Chardonnay is a sophisticated style of Chardonnay, that is full of the best elements of this classic grape varietal. The aromatics are complex and welcoming with floral and citrus tones mixed with hints of honeysuckle and butterscotch. The good percentage of oak aging brings a lovely vanilla note. The Mindbender Chardonnay is here to make you see Chardonnay in a new and innovative way. The Mindbender Chardonnay is a sophisticated style of Chardonnay, that is full of the best elements of this classic grape varietal. Visually it is golden straw in color. The aromatics are complex and welcoming with floral and citrus tones mixed with hints of honeysuckle and butterscotch. The well-rounded flavors carry the butterscotch throughout lending a smooth, creamy aspect while the citrus flavors bring freshness and brightness to the body. The good percentage of oak aging brings a lovely vanilla note. The finish is rounded out with a depth of ripe fruit flavors such as apricots, melons and peaches with a spritz of lime.

recipes.instructions: Cook the Rice: Cook the wild rice per package instructions (or boil 2 cups water in a medium pot. Add wild rice. Lower to a simmer. Cover and cook for 45 minutes or until rice is tender and starting to pop open) Set aside, uncovered, to cool.Cook white rice per package instructions, adding  teaspoon of salt to the cooking water. Spread rice over the bottom of a large bowl to cool.Caramelize the Onions: Heat butter and oil in a large skillet over medium low heat. Simmer onions, stirring occasionally, for 45 minutes or until they're soft and caramelized. Pour in a tablespoon or two of water and stir with a wooden spoon to deglaze the pan. Set aside to cool.Infuse the Cranberries with Orange Juice: Bring 1 cup orange juice to a boil in a small saucepan. Remove from heat. Stir in dried cranberries in and let them soak for 30 minutes. Drain and aside. You won't need the remaining orange juice for this recipe.Make the Vinaigrette: In a small bowl whisk  cup fresh orange juice, 1 teaspoon orange zest, vinegar, shallots, mustard and honey. Slowly add olive oil while whisking, to emulsify. Season with salt and pepper.Assemble the Salad: Combine salad ingredients with white rice: wild rice, caramelized onions, cranberries, pecans, apricots and parsley. You can make the salad ahead to this point. Cover bowl and store in the fridge overnight. Store vinaigrette in the fridge overnight. Toss salad with dressing an hour or two before serving. Serve at room temperature.
